content: the night before halloween halloween stocking crochet pattern by ashley maglich/your craft gremlin this pattern is for your personal use do not share any portions of this pattern in any form for others to use you are 100% free to sell any physical items made with this pattern please feel free to tag me @ashleymaglich or link to the pattern in any posts or mentions of ©ashleymaglich just a little back story on this crochet pattern if you wanna know about 4 years ago my daughter was in a nightmare before christmas era *i dont think i ever left it* … after watching the movie a few million times she said mama jack skellington is spooky santa so does he leave us gifts like regular santa and just like that the idea was born & my inner craft gremlin was drooling with ideas i quickly got to work on making some halloween themed stocking for us & ever since its been a fun tradition we have so we bake spooky cookies pour a glass of chocolate milk & jack skellington fills our stockings with goodies though this design isn t what our original stockings look like i wanted to put a spin on the granny hexagon thank you so much for your support i look forward to seeing what you create *from the top of the stocking down to the heel using a 3mm hook mine measured 14 inches long from the feel to the toe is 11 ½ inches this will vary based on hook size & gauge abbreviations us terms ● mc - magic_ring ● chain - chain ● single_crochet - single_crochet ● 1/2dc -half_double_crochet ● 1/2 double_crochet decrease - half_double_crochet together ● double_crochet - double_crochet ● fo - fasten_off ● slip_stitch - slip stich materials ● yarn ● 3mm crochet hook - though you can use whatever hook youd like however it will change the size of the stocking ● scissors ● darning needle - to sew in ends ©ashleymaglich round 1 *the granny hexagon* mc - *if you dont like magic circles you can certainly ch4 & slip_stitch into first chain to form your ring* ch3 *counts as 1st double_crochet* 2dc ch2 *3dc cluster ch2* repeat x5 slip_stitch to the top of the ch3 & fo if you are not changing colors you do not necessarily need to fasten_off at this point you should have 6 clusters *pull your center closed* ©ashleymaglich round 2 starting in a ch2 space ch3 *counting as 1st double_crochet* 2dc ch2 3dc you will continue this pattern all the way around *3dc ch2 3dc* slip_stitch into the top of the ch3 &fo ©ashleymaglich round 3-12 continue with the granny cluster pattern for the next 10 rounds *use whatever color combos speak to you ©ashleymaglich you are just going to do 3dc ch2 3dc at every corner space 3dc in non corner spaces *just like you would a regular granny hexagon for color changes i personally start in a corner spot ch3
